厏字的基本解释

厏
zhǎ
〔厏厊（
y?）〕不相合。

厏
zhǎi
狭窄。

厏字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhǎ］
［《廣韻》側下切，上馬，莊。］
［《廣韻》士下切，上馬，崇。］
见“厏厊”。
[②]［zhǎi］
同“窄1”。

厏字的康熙字典解释

【子集下】【厂字部】　厏； 康熙笔画：7； 页码：页161第01
【唐韻】【集韻】?側下切，音鮓。厏厊，不相合。又【集韻】仕下切，音槎。義同。又【正字通】葘格切，音摘。狹也。俗作窄。

厏字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
厏字的起名意思

暂无。

Shao
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhǎ］
["Guangyun" cut side down, mounted on horse, Zhuang. ]
["Guangyun" scholar cuts down, mounts, and Chong. ]
See "厏厊".
[②]［zhǎi］
Same as "narrow 1".
Shao
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Subset 2] [Factory Word Department] 　厏; Kangxi Strokes: 7; Page Number: Page 161 01
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun]? Cut side down, sound sacred. It's awkward, it doesn't fit. [Jiyun] Shixia cuts again, Yincha. The same meaning. Also [Zhengzitong] Binge cut, phonetic excerpt. Sayama. Vulgar is narrow.
